Job Title: Electrical Assembler II - Avionics

Location: Lake Forest, CA

Employment Type: full-time

Listed Skills: Management, Manufacturing

Description:
JOB TITLE: Electrical Assembler II (Avionics)LOCATION: Lake Forest, CASCHEDULE: Full Time Onsite (5 days a week) Panasonic Avionics Corporation (PAC) is looking to hire an Electrical Assembler to join our corporate team of experts to work on, replace and improve the performance of IFE (in-flight entertainment) systems on planes for some of the most recognized airlines across the globe. As the #1 provider of IFE products in the world, Panasonic Avionics offers a great culture, training platform, and long-term career trajectory that is designed to make your career TAKE OFF! Hourly rate ranges from $17.21 to $29.33 based on years of experience. This is a full time, direct hire position, offering full medical, dental, vision, 401k, and life insurance and annual bonus. Additional benefits include tuition reimbursement, two weeks of accruable PTO, 141paid Company Holidays, 7 sick days, and 3 personal days. Ask your recruiter about additional perks to work with PAC. WHO IS PANASONIC AVIONICS? If you've ever boarded a plane with a video display on the seat in front of you, offering Movies, TV, Gaming, Wi-Fi and Bluetooth Audio; there's a great chance that Panasonic Avionics is behind it all. And we are looking for the best and brightest to join our Panasonic Technical Services Team to help us continue to provide the best In-Class Services. JOB SUMMARYPerforms a wide variety of electronic or electro-mechanical assembly operations on assemblies or sub- assemblies. Determines and/or follows methods and sequence of operations in performing wiring, component installation, hand soldering and cable harnessing on assembly units.

MAJOR RESPONSIBILITIES· Build cable, harnessing and mechanical assemblies.

 Position and align parts and components. Secure them in place or remove them using appropriate, various methods including soldering, crimping, fastening, gluing, etc. Install assemblies in cases or cabinets. Bundle and route wiring within the product being worked. Perform initial tests to check for faulty parts, continuity, etc. Tend to machines that prepare or assemble parts. Build printed wiring board assemblies and perform rework and modifications of prototype boards. Assist engineers in building bread boards. Assist engineers with sheet metal modifications. Build setups and adjustments holding tolerances to blueprint specifications. Read and interpret work orders and follow drawings or sample assemblies to facilitate assembly work. WHAT YOU MUST HAVE: High school diploma or equivalent. Must have 2 or more years’ experience performing electro-mechanical assembly with an emphasis on cable/ harness rework and electronic/ electrical soldering and termination. Must have skilled knowledge of cable and harness rework and fabrication including pinning and depinning, various termination methods, labeling and dressing, wire routing, splicing, etc. Must have excellent SMT (surface mount technology) and THT (through-hole technology) skills. Must have proficient ability to read schematic diagrams and blueprints and interpret for work performance. Skilled ability to using hand tools, limited power tools, soldering irons including under a microscope, and basic machining equipment. Ability to follow procedures and adhere to regulations related to work being performed. Applies acquired job skills and company policies and procedures to complete assigned tasks. Receives assignments, scheduling and assembly instructions from Lab Supervisor and Lead person. Works on assignments that are semi-routine in nature but recognizes the need for occasional deviation from accepted practice. Normally follows established procedures on routine work and requires instructions only on new assignments. OTHER REQUIREMENTS· Ability to lift, push and pull from up to 40 lbs. on a daily basis. Ability to perform repetitive motion including bending, twisting and various hand and arm movements. Ability to stand and sit for extended periods.

Experience Level (if available): Entry level
